result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel O. Bourdo

defendant.name: Bourdo, Daniel O.
defendant.address: 2301 College Ave., Lot 706, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK; Court Reporter-Mary Heederik] 
case called at 8:57am.
Defendant Daniel O Bourdo not in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today and the State's witness from the Child Support Agency is present. 
On Motion of the State, the Court issues a Bench Warrant-Body Only, returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate.  
The Court finds the cash bond to be in default. 
recess 8:59am
reconvene 10:05am
ADA Teuber provides information that Mr. Bourdo was found passed out this morning by the Elkhorn Police Department, and that he is now in the Walworth County Jail. 
The Court vacates the orders made previously today. 
recess 10:07am

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on November 15th at 8:30am
Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 1:45pm 
 Defendant Daniel O. Bourdo appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Kayla Barteck (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies date of birth, updates address to: 2301 College Ave. Lot 706, Oak Creek, WI 53154
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $250 CASH Bond.
recess 1:53  pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 10/21/22 at 8:30am

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel O. Bourdo
Current: 2301 College Ave., Lot 706, Oak Creek, WI 53154 United States  (Effective: 07-06-2022)
Prior: c/o Walworth County Jail 1770 County Rd NN, Elkhorn, WI 53121

[ae] case called 8:48 AM Defendant Daniel O. Bourdo not in court.  ADA Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The Court reviews the Certificate of Non-Service.
The State requests that a probable cause warrant be issued. Upon review of the file the Court finds probable cause and issues warrant body only.  
recess 08:54 AM
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (08/19) ML
Initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ae] case called 11:09 AM Defendant Daniel O. Bourdo not in court. ADA Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The Court adjourns for personal service
NEXT: IA 9/12/22 at 8:30 am
Recess 11:13 AM
NOTE: Copy of complaint sent to Daniel Bourdo at the Jefferson Co. Jail on 07/06/2022. (NMS)
